topic_page.title: Skin & Cosmetic Health

intro.what_this_topic_means: This topic helps you browse peptides commonly associated with: Wrinkles, texture, hydration, barrier function, cosmetic peptides. Associations reflect search interest and categorization—not recommendations.
common_misconceptions: Association with a topic is not proof of benefit.
Preclinical or mechanistic evidence is not the same as proven human outcomes.
Short-term biomarker changes do not guarantee long-term safety or effectiveness.
who_should_be_extra_cautious: Adolescents and young adults (developmental setpoints may still be calibrating)
Anyone on multiple medications or with significant medical comorbidity

how_to_use_this_page: Topics help you browse; they do not recommend peptides.
Always check status and risk score first.
Human evidence and preclinical evidence are separated.

safety_callouts.title: Adolescents and development
safety_callouts.body: If you are under 18, treat uncertainty as part of the risk. Many compounds have little to no adolescent data, and endocrine/metabolic effects may have long-lived consequences.

evidence_notes.title: Why evidence changes
evidence_notes.body: Status and evidence can change as trials publish or regulators update labeling. This app aims to track updates and tie key claims to specific sources.

evidence_notes.title: Absence of evidence is not evidence of safety
evidence_notes.body: Many compounds have limited human exposure data, short study durations, or outcomes that don’t capture rare or delayed harms. When uncertainty is high, the risk score reflects that explicitly.
